LandingPage.pythonP: Take one of Udemy’s range of Python courses and learn how to code using this incredibly useful language. Its simple syntax and readability makes Python perfect for Flask, Django, data science, and machine learning. You’ll learn how to build everything from games to sites to apps. LandingPage.excelP: Take a Microsoft Excel course from Udemy, and learn how to use this industry-standard software. Real-world experts will show you the basics like how to organize data into sheets, rows and columns, and advanced techniques like creating complex dynamic formulas. LandingPage.webH: Build websites and applications with Web Development
LandingPage.webP: The world of web development is as wide as the internet itself. Much of our social and vocational lives play out on the internet, which prompts new industries aimed at creating, managing, and debugging the websites and applications that we increasingly rely on.
LandingPage.jsH: Grow your software development skills with JavaScript
LandingPage.jsP: JavaScript is a text-based computer programming language used to make dynamic web pages. A must-learn for aspiring web developers or programmers, JavaScript can be used for features like image carousels, displaying countdowns and timers, and playing media on a webpage. With JavaScript online classes, you can learn to build

Explore data science courses with Python, statistics, machine learning, and more to grow your knowledge. Get data science training if you’re into research, statistics...

Whether or not you aim for certification, an AWS course offers the theory and practical skills you need to land a job in cloud development, sales, engineering, networking, and more. Signup.terms1: By signing up, you agree to our

Teaching.banner2: Become an instructor and change lives — including your own
Teaching.reasons12: Publish the course you want, in the way you want, and always have control of your own content.0
Teaching.reasons22: Teach what you know and help learners explore their interests, gain new skills, and advance their careers.
Teaching.reasons32: Expand your professional network, build your expertise, and earn money on each paid enrollment.
Teaching.ct1: You start with your passion and knowledge. Then choose a promising topic with the help of our Marketplace Insights tool.
Teaching.ct2: The way that you teach — what you bring to it — is up to you.
Teaching.ct4: We offer plenty of resources on how to create your first course. And, our instructor dashboard and curriculum pages help keep you organized.
Teaching.v1: Use basic tools like a smartphone or a DSLR camera. Add a good microphone and you’re ready to start.
Teaching.v2: If you don’t like being on camera, just capture your screen. Either way, we recommend two hours or more of video for a paid course.
Teaching.v4: Our support team is available to help you throughout the process and provide feedback on test videos.
Teaching.c1: Gather your first ratings and reviews by promoting your course through social media and your professional networks.
Teaching.c2: Your course will be discoverable in our marketplace where you earn revenue from each paid enrollment.
Teaching.c4: Our custom coupon tool lets you offer enrollment incentives while our global promotions drive traffic to courses.There’s even more opportunity for courses chosen for UdemyBusiness.
Teaching.KDescription: I’m proud to wake up knowing my work is helping people around the world improve their careers and build great things. While being a full-time instructor is hard work, it lets you work when, where, and how you want.
Teaching.PDescription: Udemy has changed my life. It’s allowed me to follow my passion and become a teacher I love to see my students succeed and hear them say they’ve learned more, quicker, from my courses than they did in college. It’s so humbling.
Teaching.DDescription: Teaching on Udemy has provided me with two important elements: the opportunity to reach more learners than I ever would be able to on my own and a steady stream of extra income.
Teaching.doAlone: You won’t have to do it alone
Teaching.doAlonet3: is here to answer your questions and review your test video, while our
Teaching.doAlonet5: gives you plenty of resources to help you through the process. Plus, get the support of experienced instructors in our
Teaching.doAlonet7: Need more details before you start? Learn more.
Teaching.join: Join one of the world’s largest online learning marketplaces.

CoursesPage.t1: Based on your experience, we think these resources will be helpful.
CoursesPage.t2: Have questions? Here are our most popular instructor resources.
CoursesPage.cardd1: Whether you've been teaching for years or are teaching for the first time, you can make an engaging course. We've compiled resources and best practices to help you get to the next level, no matter where you're starting.
CoursesPage.cardd2: Quality video lectures can set your course apart. Use our resources to learn the basics.
CoursesPage.cardd3: Set your course up for success by building your audience
CoursesPage.cardd4: Get exclusive tips and resources designed to help you launch your first course faster! Eligible instructors who publish their first course on time will receive a special bonus to celebrate. Start today!
CoursesPage.helpd: Browse our Help Center or contact our support team.
CoursesPage.insightsd: Validate your course topic by exploring our marketplace supply and demand.
CoursesPage.teachingd: Learn about best practices for teaching on Udemy.
CoursesPage.communityd: Connect with experienced instructors. Ask questions, browse discussions, and more
CoursesPage.testd: Send us a sample video and get expert feedback.

ProfileSettings.title: Profile & Settings
ProfileSettings.headline: Headline
ProfileSettings.biographydescription: To help learners learn more about you, your bio should reflect your Credibility, Empathy, Passion, and Personality. Your biography should have at least 50 words, links and coupon codes are not permitted.
ProfileSettings.showCourses: Show courses you're taking on your profile page
ProfileSettings.showProfile: Show your profile to logged-in users

Topics.explore_courses: Explore courses from experienced, real-world experts.
Topics.many_learners_enjoyed: Many learners enjoyed this highly rated course for its engaging content.
Topics.join_learners: Join more than 12 million learners and train up on JavaScript on Udemy. Choose from a wide range of top-rated JavaScript courses. From back-end development to app or website building, we’ve got you covered. Our real-world experts can lead you through hands-on projects to apply your skills.
Topics.not_sure: Not sure? All courses have a 30-day money-back guarantee.

CourseManagmentContent.public_descriptions: The following descriptions will be publicly visible on your
CourseManagmentContent.course_impact_description: and will have a direct impact on your course performance. These descriptions will help learners decide if your course is right for them.
CourseManagmentContent.subtitles_importance: Learners of all levels of language proficiency highly value subtitles as it helps follow, understand and memorize the content. Also having subtitles to ensure the content is accessible for those that are deaf or hard of hearing is crucial.
CourseManagmentContent.add_video_lectures: When you add video lectures to your course via the
CourseManagmentContent.add_captions_info: you will be able to add captions to those videos here.

CreateCourse.busy_now: I’m very busy right now (0-2 hours)
CreateCourse.work_on_side: I’ll work on this on the side (2-4 hours)
CreateCourse.lots_of_flexibility: I have lots of flexibility (5+ hours)
CreateCourse.undecided_time: I haven’t yet decided if I have time
CreateCourse.first_question: First, let's find out what type of course you're making.
CreateCourse.create_learning_experiences: Create rich learning experiences with the help of video lectures, quizzes, coding exercises, etc.
CreateCourse.good_title_message: It's ok if you can't think of a good title now. You can change it later.
CreateCourse.best_fit_category: What category best fits the knowledge you'll share?
CreateCourse.category_change_message: If you're not sure about the right category, you can change it later.
CreateCourse.time_commitment: How much time can you spend creating your course per week?
CreateCourse.time_commitment_message: There's no wrong answer. We can help you achieve your goals even if you don't have much time.

CourseLandingPage.course_landing_page_message: Your course landing page is crucial to your success on Udemy. If it’s done right, it can also help you gain visibility in search engines like Google. As you complete this section, think about creating a compelling Course Landing Page that demonstrates why someone would want to enroll in your course. Learn more about
CourseLandingPage.title_guidelines: Your title should be a mix of attention-grabbing, informative, and optimized for search
CourseLandingPage.subtitle_guidelines: Use 1 or 2 related keywords, and mention 3-4 of the most important areas that you’ve covered during your course.
CourseLandingPage.what_is_taught: What is primarily taught in your course?
CourseLandingPage.topic_description: Each individual topic chosen should comprehensively describe your course's content without being too broad. E.g. "The Complete Tennis Course" should have "Tennis" – not "Tennis Serve" (specific, but not comprehensive) and not "Sports" (comprehensive, but not specific).
CourseLandingPage.upload_course_image: Upload your course image here. It must meet our
CourseLandingPage.course_image_guidelines: to be accepted. Important guidelines: 750x422 pixels; .jpg, .jpeg, .gif, or .png. No text on the image.
CourseLandingPage.upload_promotional_video: Upload your promotional video here. It must meet our
CourseLandingPage.video_guidelines: to be accepted. Important guidelines: MP4 format, maximum size 100MB.

CourseMessages.welcome_message: Write messages to your students (optional) that will be sent automatically when they join or complete your course to encourage students to engage with course content. If you do not wish to send a welcome or congratulations message, leave the text box blank.

CourseStructure.course_plan: There's a course in you. Plan it out.
CourseStructure.tips_guides: Tips and guides to structuring a course students love
CourseStructure.setting_goals: Setting goals for what learners will accomplish in your course (also known as
CourseStructure.content_inclusion: ) at the beginning will help you determine what content to include in your course and how you will teach the content to help your learners achieve the goals.
CourseStructure.decide_skills: Decide what skills you’ll teach and how you’ll teach them. Group related lectures into sections. Each section should have at least 3 lectures, and include at least one assignment or practical activity.
CourseStructure.introduction_section: People online want to start learning quickly. Make an introduction section that gives learners something to be excited about in the first 10 minutes.
CourseStructure.section_learning_objective: Sections have a clear learning objective.
CourseStructure.section_description: Introduce each section by describing the section's
CourseStructure.lectures_sections_titles: Give lectures and sections titles that reflect their content and have a logical flow.
CourseStructure.good_lecture_length: A good lecture length is 2-7 minutes to keep students interested and help them study in short bursts. Cover a single topic in each lecture so learners can easily find and re-watch them later.
CourseStructure.mix_and_match_lecture_types: Mix and match your lecture types.
CourseStructure.alternate_lecture_formats: Alternate between filming yourself, your screen, and slides or other visuals.
CourseStructure.real_world_application: To their real world with projects, assignments, coding exercises, or worksheets.
CourseStructure.course_quality_requirements: Complete list of course quality requirements
CourseStructure.at_least_five_lectures: Your course must have at least five lectures
CourseStructure.total_video_duration: All lectures must add up to at least 30+ minutes of total video
CourseStructure.valuable_content: Your course is composed of valuable educational content and free of promotional or distracting materials
CourseStructure.trust_safety_description: Our policies for instructors and students
CourseStructure.instructor_community_description: A place to connect with other instructors
CourseStructure.official_udemy_course: Official Udemy Course: How to Create an Online Course
CourseStructure.course_creation_description: Learn about course creation from the Udemy Instructor Team and experienced instructors

Accessibility.accessibility_description: Accessibility provides a person with a disability access to — and benefits of — the same information, interactions, and services as a person without a disability in a way that’s sensible, meaningful, and usable. In short, it’s the inclusive practice of ensuring there are no barriers to learning for as many people as possible.
Accessibility.broaden_reach: Some may think that accessibility is primarily aimed at helping people with physical disabilities, such as those with hearing or vision loss. However, making content accessible to everyone isn’t just the equitable thing to do, it also helps to broaden your reach so that more learners can benefit from your courses.
Accessibility.checklist_description: To help you create accessible course content, we’ve provided Instructors with recommendations and best practices to consider while creating new courses or updating existing content. Please review these accessibility recommendations and checklists to indicate whether your course meets the guidelines.
Accessibility.guidelines_note: Note: while these accessibility guidelines are strongly recommended, they are not a requirement prior to publishing your course. Though content that does meet these accessibility guidelines may benefit from a greater number of learners who could take your course.
Accessibility.caption_accuracy: All auto-generated captions should be reviewed to check for accuracy. Captions must meet a 99% rate of accuracy.
Accessibility.sound_effects: Any relevant sound effects pertinent to the course must be noted in the captions, example: (Beeps).
Accessibility.non_speech_elements: Any non-speech elements such as music are captured in the captions, example: (Jazzy music).
Accessibility.verbal_delivery_indicators: Verbal delivery style indicators are captured in the captions, example: (Exclaims).
Accessibility.identify_speakers: Captions identify speakers on and off camera.
Accessibility.captionsGuidelines: Captions in this course meet these guidelines
Accessibility.audioCanStandAlone: Audio can stand on its own, like an audiobook.
Accessibility.visualContentExplained: Visual content (when not just for decoration) is explained.
Accessibility.interactionsExplained: Interactions shown on screen are fully explained, without skipping steps.
Accessibility.spokenContentPlainLanguage: Spoken content uses plain language, at a measured (not too quick) pace.
Accessibility.avoidFiguresOfSpeech: Figures of speech, idioms, jargon, or slang are avoided, and unfamiliar terms or acronyms are defined.
Accessibility.captionsReviewedForAccuracy: Captions for all spoken content have been reviewed for accuracy - especially proper names, acronyms, abbreviations, and technical terms.
Accessibility.tableOfContentsProvided: A table of contents for long documents and a glossary of terms are provided.
Accessibility.semanticMarkupApplied: Semantic markup for headings, bulleted lists, or numbered lists has been applied to all documents.
Accessibility.contentOrganizedShortParagraphs: Content is organized in short paragraphs and/or simple tables.
Accessibility.descriptiveLinks: Links to external resources use descriptive language.
Accessibility.alternativeTextProvided: Alternative text is provided for all images in documents or slide presentations.
Accessibility.strongColorContrast: Strong color contrast has been used for text and images.
Accessibility.materialsMeetGuidelines: Materials attached to this course meet these guidelines
